protocol_name: Sexual Orientation and Mental Health among Undergraduates of 10 Universities in Guangzhou, China
protocol_name_html: Sexual Orientation and Mental Health among Undergraduates of 10 Universities in Guangzhou, China
protocol_affiliation: Mental Health Center of Xiangya hospital, Central South University

authors_list.name: Yuan Yan
authors_list.affiliation: Mental Health Center of Xiangya hospital, Central South University

authors_list.name: Haihong Liu
authors_list.affiliation: Mental Health Center of Xiangya hospital, Central South University

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: A stratified random sampling design was used in this study.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: A stratified random sampling design was used in this study.

components.data: Firstly, we obtained the number of undergraduates of each university and the percentage of 121,181 undergraduates of the all 10 universities.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Firstly, we obtained the number of undergraduates of each university and the percentage of 121,181 undergraduates of the all 10 universities.

components.data: Secondly, the target sample size was set as 10,000, and the percentages were used to calculate each university's sample size.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Secondly, the target sample size was set as 10,000, and the percentages were used to calculate each university's sample size.

components.data: Thirdly, randomized sampling was performed at class-level (about 30 students in a class) for each university.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Thirdly, randomized sampling was performed at class-level (about 30 students in a class) for each university.

components.data: Finally, the final sample of 9071 university students was obtained.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Finally, the final sample of 9071 university students was obtained.

components.data: A self-administered questionnaire was given to 9,071(7.5%) of 121,181undergraduates across all 10universities in HEMC in the fall semester of 2015 in Guangzhou, China.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: A self-administered questionnaire was given to 9,071(7.5%) of 121,181undergraduates across all 10universities in HEMC in the fall semester of 2015 in Guangzhou, China.

components.data: A total of 8,320(91.7%of 9,071) students filled in the questionnaires and 8,182 of them responded to the question on sexual orientation, yielding a response rate of 90.2% and a refusal rate of 9.8%.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: A total of 8,320(91.7%of 9,071) students filled in the questionnaires and 8,182 of them responded to the question on sexual orientation, yielding a response rate of 90.2% and a refusal rate of 9.8%.

components.data: Informed consent was given orally by participants at the beginning of the survey outside of school hours. The consent document was read out and any questions on the survey's purpose, content, confidentiality, participant's right, benefit and risk were answered immediately and discussed.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Informed consent was given orally by participants at the beginning of the survey outside of school hours. The consent document was read out and any questions on the survey's purpose, content, confidentiality, participant's right, benefit and risk were answered immediately and discussed.

components.data: There were no incentives to join the survey and participants were able quit at any time without any risk. Participation was completely voluntary and all personal information was kept strictly confidential for the purpose of the study. The consent procedure and the study were approved by the Ethics Committee, Xiangya School of Public Health, Central South University.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: There were no incentives to join the survey and participants were able quit at any time without any risk. Participation was completely voluntary and all personal information was kept strictly confidential for the purpose of the study. The consent procedure and the study were approved by the Ethics Committee, Xiangya School of Public Health, Central South University.

components.data: Sexual orientation was measured using a single item on a 5-point scale with the instruction,“Please circle a number on the line scale which best describes your sexual orientation, 1 indicates exclusively heterosexual, 5 indicates exclusively homosexual.”
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sexual orientation was measured using a single item on a 5-point scale with the instruction,“Please circle a number on the line scale which best describes your sexual orientation, 1 indicates exclusively heterosexual, 5 indicates exclusively homosexual.”

components.data: Statistical analysis Firstly, we described the demographic characteristics of the total sample by self-reported sexual orientation among undergraduate students in Guangzhou, China. Secondly, Chi-square tests were used to determine the association between the demographics and sexual orientation. Thirdly, after the assumption of proportional odds was tested by using Test of Parallel Lines (p>0.05) , multivariable ordinal regression analysis was used for examining the association between demographic variables and self-reported sexual orientation. The results are reported as odds ratios (OR) with 95% confidence interval (CI).
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Statistical analysis Firstly, we described the demographic characteristics of the total sample by self-reported sexual orientation among undergraduate students in Guangzhou, China. Secondly, Chi-square tests were used to determine the association between the demographics and sexual orientation. Thirdly, after the assumption of proportional odds was tested by using Test of Parallel Lines (p>0.05) , multivariable ordinal regression analysis was used for examining the association between demographic variables and self-reported sexual orientation. The results are reported as odds ratios (OR) with 95% confidence interval (CI).
